fullDescription.intro: This node can visualize a supply chain. The three input ports expect a station table, an delivery table and a delivery relations table. These tables are provided by the Supply Chain Analyzer. Tracing can be performed by setting the following four properties for stations and deliveries: "Case Weight", "Cross Contamination", "Kill Contamination" and "Observed". Each of the properties can be set in the respective tab. Based on these properties the following values are computed: "Score", "Normalized Score", "Forward", "Backward".

tab.name: Station Properties
tab.option: Weights for stations. The computed scores are based on these weights.
Set cross contamination for stations. That means all incoming deliveries can contaminate all outgoing deliveries (see "Enforce Temporal Order").
Set kill contamination for stations. That means contaminations from incoming deliveries are killed. Outgoing deliveries are therefore uncontaminated.
For all stations/deliveries that can reached by forward/backward tracing from stations selected here, the "Forward"/"Backward" property is set to true.

tab.name: Delivery Properties
tab.option: Weights for deliveries. The computed scores are based on these weights.

Set cross contamination for deliveries. Similar to "Station Cross Contamination", but unselected (no cross contamination) incoming deliveries and outgoing deliveries, that are only connected to unselected incoming deliveries, are excluded from the cross contamination.
Set kill contamination for deliveries. That means contaminations from these deliveries are killed. Connected outgoing deliveries are therefore uncontaminated.
For all stations/deliveries that can reached by forward/backward tracing from deliveries selected here, the "Forward"/"Backward" is set to true.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: If checked, the delivery date is used for cross contamination. That means a delivery can only contaminate deliveries with a later date.
Allows to apply a filter to all stations/deliveries. Only filtered stations/deliveries are shown in the table.
Clears the input in the table. True/false values are set to false and numbers are set to zero.
Sets all the values for all filtered stations/deliveries to "true"/"specfied value".

ports.inPort: Table with Station data. Is provided by first out port of Supply Chain Reader.
Table with Delivery data. Is provided by second out port of Supply Chain Reader.
Model that contains the relations between deliveries. Is provided by third out port of Supply Chain Reader.
ports.outPort: Table with Station data and tracing results.
Table with Delivery data and tracing results.
